DOC.brief_summary: The aim study compare conservative versus aggressive strategy patient intermediate lesion angiography guidance alone .
DOC.brief_title: Conservative Versus Aggressive Revascularization Patients With Intermediate Lesions Undergoing Percutaneous Coronary Intervention With Angiography Guidance Alone
DOC.detailed_description: To investigate whether conservative revascularization use criterion 70 % diameter stenosis would non-inferior aggressive revascularization use criterion 50 % diameter stenosis coronary intermediate lesion , conduct Conservative Revascularization versus Aggressive Revascularization Coronary Stenting Everolimus-Eluting Stents ( SMART-CASE ) trial .
DOC.criteria: Intermediate coronary lesion ( ) ( diameter stenosis 50 % 70 % quantitative coronary analysis ) Target lesion ( ) must locate native coronary artery diameter ≥2.25 mm ≤4.25 mm cardiogenic shock myocardial infarction ( MI ) within 48 hour leave main lesion drugeluting stent implantation target vessel prior enrollment ≥2 chronic total occlusion major coronary territory history bleed diathesis know coagulopathy gastrointestinal genitourinary bleeding within 3 month major surgery within 2 month platelet count < 100,000 cells/mm3 plan elective surgical procedure would necessitate interruption thienopyridine first 6 month enrollment noncardiac comorbid condition life expectancy < 1 year may result protocol noncompliance ( per site investigator 's medical judgment ) .
